content: ws toe k 28 30/34 sole sts pm pick up and knit 28 30/34 sts over the instep flap pm for bor start working in the round k all s cid 415 tches slipping the markers un cid 415 l you reach 4cm 4 5cm/4 5cm before end of foot decrease round k1 ssk k to 3sts before m k2tog k1 sm k1 ssk k to 3sts before m k2tog k1 even round k all sts repeat decrease and even rounds un cid 415 l 2x 8 12/14 sts are le cid 332 cut yarn leaving enough tail to gra cid 332 the remaining sts weave in ends cuff pick up and knit 2x 28 30/34 sts k2 p2 for 12 rounds bind off with a stretchy method of your choice repeat for second sock block or wear directly gi cid 332 them and start another pair my personal thoughts 1 i recommend to double-check the bead quan cid 415 ty you have stringed as you cannot add beads a cid 332 er you have started kni cid 427 ng 2 your odd row are the ones you are working on s cid 415 ll they are your ws the even row your rs are always knit all s cid 415 tches 3 every odd round starts and ends with a sl1pwyf so that your edges are nice for picking up s cid 415 tches later 4 your s cid 415 tch with bead in front is the s cid 415 tch you count not the bead 5 make sure that the bead stays in front of the s cid 415 tch so that it is si cid 427 ng between 2 s cid 415 tches don t let it travel into the s cid 415 tch 6 the long flap with 25/30/35 s cid 415 tches will be your instep 7 make the connec cid 415 on to the bind-off side of the instep flap loose it has less stretch than the cast-on side of the instep flap © silke strohschenk please respect my work for private use only 6 © silke strohschenk please respect my work for private use only 7 © silke strohschenk please respect my work for private use only
